thread.title: Gold coin donation found in Salvation Army kettle in Phoenix worth over $1,300 | FOX 10 Phoenix
thread.title_full: Gold coin donation found in Salvation Army kettle in Phoenix worth over $1,300 | FOX 10 Phoenix

author: Tom Kuebel
title: Gold coin donation found in Salvation Army kettle in Phoenix worth over $1,300 | FOX 10 Phoenix
text:
Gold coin donation found in Salvation Army kettle in Phoenix worth over $1,300 By Tom Kuebel Published December 26, 2024 3:26pm MST Phoenix FOX 10 Phoenix Share
Copy Link Email Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Reddit article
The Brief A Good Samaritan dropped off a $1,300 gold coin in a donation jar at a Salvation Army location in Phoenix. The person left a letter attached to the coin hoping wishing good blessings to people in need this Christmas. It was donated to the Ray & Joan Kroc Center in Phoenix. PHOENIX - The Salvation Army said that one Good Samaritan dropped a half-ounce gold American Eagle coin in a donation kettle at its Ray & Joan Kroc Center location in Phoenix.
The face value of the coin is $25 but an officer with the Salvation Army said it was appraised for $1,310.
"We witness extraordinary acts of kindness and giving year-round, and this incredible donation is certainly no exception," said Captain Dustin Rowe, Kroc Center Corps Officer. "We want to thank this generous donor from the bottom of our hearts."
The coin came attached with a letter that said, "May this gold help the people in need during the Christmas season. Bless you all."
Watch FOX 10 Phoenix live: Donations to the Salvation army can be written off as a state tax credit.
The maximum donation for a single person is $470 and for married couples it is $938.
84 cents out of every dollar are used to support local programs and services.
The Ray & Joan Kroc Center hosts a variety of events and classes ranging from swimming to arts and crafts and sports.
The location is located near the intersection of Dr. MLK Jr. Boulevard and 14th Street.
The Source: Information for this story was provided by the Salvation Army.
